row-key.desc: Property of each row that defines the unique key of each row (the result must be a primitive, not Object, Array, etc); The value of property must be string or a function taking a row and returning the desired (nested) key in the row; If supplying a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

virtual-scroll.desc: Display data using QVirtualScroll (for non-grid mode only)

virtual-scroll-slice-size.desc: Minimum number of rows to render in the virtual list

virtual-scroll-slice-ratio-before.desc: Ratio of number of rows in visible zone to render before it

virtual-scroll-slice-ratio-after.desc: Ratio of number of rows in visible zone to render after it

virtual-scroll-item-size.desc: Default size in pixels of a row; This value is used for rendering the initial table; Try to use a value close to the minimum size of a row

virtual-scroll-sticky-size-start.desc: Size in pixels of the sticky header (if using one); A correct value will improve scroll precision

virtual-scroll-sticky-size-end.desc: Size in pixels of the sticky footer part (if using one); A correct value will improve scroll precision

table-colspan.desc: The number of columns in the table (you need this if you use table-layout: fixed)

icon-first-page.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to first page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

icon-prev-page.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to previous page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

icon-next-page.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to next page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

icon-last-page.desc: Icon name following Quasar convention for stepping to last page; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

grid.desc: Display data as a grid instead of the default table

dense.desc: Dense mode; Connect with $q.screen for responsive behavior

name.desc: Unique id, identifies column, (used by pagination.sortBy, 'body-cell-[name]' slot, ...)

field.desc: Row Object property to determine value for this column or function which maps to the required property

required.desc: If we use visible-columns, this col will always be visible

align.desc: Horizontal alignment of cells in this column

sortable.desc: Tell QTable you want this column sortable

sort.desc: Compare function if you have some custom data or want a specific way to compare two rows

a.desc: Value of the first comparison term

b.desc: Value of the second comparison term

rowA.desc: Full Row object in which is contained the first term

rowB.desc: Full Row object in which is contained the second term

returns.desc: Comparison result of term 'a' with term 'b'. Less than 0 when 'a' should come first; greater than 0 if 'b' should come first; equal to 0 if their position must not be changed with respect to each other

sortOrder.desc: Set column sort order: 'ad' (ascending-descending) or 'da' (descending-ascending); Overrides the 'column-sort-order' prop

format.desc: Function you can apply to format your data
examples: val => val ? /* Unicode checkmark checked */ '☑' : /* Unicode checkmark unchecked */ '☐'

row.desc: Full Row object in which the cell is contained

style.desc: Style to apply on normal cells of the column; The Function form requires v1.15.15+

classes.desc: Classes to add on normal cells of the column; The Function form requires v1.15.15+

headerStyle.desc: Style to apply on header cells of the column

headerClasses.desc: Classes to add on header cells of the column

visible-columns.desc: Array of Strings defining column names ('name' property of each column from 'columns' prop definitions); Columns marked as 'required' are not affected by this property

loading.desc: Put Table into 'loading' state; Notify the user something is happening behind the covers

hide-bottom.desc: Hide table bottom layer regardless of what it has to display

hide-selected-banner.desc: Hide the selected rows banner (if any)

hide-no-data.desc: Hide the default no data bottom layer

hide-pagination.desc: Hide the pagination controls at the bottom

separator.desc: Use a separator/border between rows, columns or all cells

binary-state-sort.desc: Skip the third state (unsorted) when user toggles column sort direction

column-sort-order.desc: Set column sort order: 'ad' (ascending-descending) or 'da' (descending-ascending); It gets applied to all columns unless a column has its own sortOrder specified in the 'columns' definition prop

no-data-label.desc: Override default text to display when no data is available

no-results-label.desc: Override default text to display when user filters the table and no matched results are found

loading-label.desc: Override default text to display when table is in loading state (see 'loading' prop)

selected-rows-label.desc: Text to display when user selected at least one row; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

rows-per-page-label.desc: Text to override default rows per page label at bottom of table

pagination-label.desc: Text to override default pagination label at bottom of table (unless 'pagination' scoped slot is used); For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

totalRowsNumber.desc: Number of total rows available in data

table-style.desc: CSS style to apply to native HTML <table> element's wrapper (which is a DIV)

table-class.desc: CSS classes to apply to native HTML <table> element's wrapper (which is a DIV)

table-header-style.desc: CSS style to apply to header of native HTML <table> (which is a TR)

table-header-class.desc: CSS classes to apply to header of native HTML <table> (which is a TR)

card-container-style.desc: CSS style to apply to the cards container (when in grid mode)

card-container-class.desc: CSS classes to apply to the cards container (when in grid mode)

card-style.desc: CSS style to apply to the card (when in grid mode) or container card (when not in grid mode)

card-class.desc: CSS classes to apply to the card (when in grid mode) or container card (when not in grid mode)

title-class.desc: CSS classes to apply to the title (if using 'title' prop)

filter.desc: String/Object to filter table with; When using an Object it requires 'filter-method' to also be specified since it will be a custom filtering

filter-method.desc: The actual filtering mechanism; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

terms.desc: Terms to filter with (is essentially the 'filter' prop value)

getCellValue.desc: Optional function to get a cell value

pagination.desc: Pagination object; You can use the '.sync' modifier on it if you want to have access on the current pagination in your components; When not using the .sync modifier it simply initializes the pagination on first render

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

rowsNumber.desc: For server-side fetching only. How many total database rows are there to be added to the table. If set, causes the QTable to emit @request when data is required.

rows-per-page-options.desc: Options for user to pick (Numbers); Number 0 means 'Show all rows in one page'

expanded.desc: Keeps the array with expanded rows keys

sort-method.desc: The actual sort mechanism. Function (rows, sortBy, descending) => sorted rows; For best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

loading.desc: Override default effect when table is in loading state; Suggestion: QInnerLoading

item.desc: Slot to use for defining an item when in 'grid' mode; Suggestion: QCard

rowIndex.desc: Row/Item's index (0 based) in the filtered and sorted table

pageIndex.desc: Row/Item's index (0 based) in the current page of the filtered and sorted table

colsMap.desc: Column mapping (key is column name, value is column object)

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

selected.desc: (Only if using selection) Is row/item selected? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes selection state

expand.desc: Is row/item expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

body.desc: Slot to define how a body row looks like; Suggestion: QTr + Td

rowIndex.desc: Row's index (0 based) in the filtered and sorted table

pageIndex.desc: Row's index (0 based) in the current page of the filtered and sorted table

colsMap.desc: Column mapping (key is column name, value is column object)

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

selected.desc: (Only if using selection) Is row selected? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes selection state

expand.desc: Is row expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

__trClass.desc: Internal prop passed down to QTr (if used)

body-cell.desc: Slot to define how all body cells look like; Suggestion: QTd

col.desc: Column definition for column associated with table cell

rowIndex.desc: Row's index (0 based) in the filtered and sorted table

pageIndex.desc: Row's index (0 based) in the current page of the filtered and sorted table

colsMap.desc: Column mapping (key is column name, value is column object)

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

selected.desc: (Only if using selection) Is row selected? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes selection state

expand.desc: Is row expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

body-cell-[name].desc: Slot to define how a specific column cell looks like; replace '[name]' with column name (from columns definition object)

col.desc: Column definition for column associated with table cell

rowIndex.desc: Row's index (0 based) in the filtered and sorted table

pageIndex.desc: Row's index (0 based) in the current page of the filtered and sorted table

colsMap.desc: Column mapping (key is column name, value is column object)

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

selected.desc: (Only if using selection) Is row selected? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes selection state

expand.desc: Is row expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

header.desc: Slot to define how header looks like; Suggestion: QTr + QTh

colsMap.desc: Column mapping (key is column name, value is column object)

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

selected.desc: (Only if using selection) Is row selected? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes selection state

expand.desc: Is row expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

__trClass.desc: Internal prop passed down to QTr (if used)

header.desc: Internal prop passed down to QTh (if used); Always 'true'

header-cell.desc: Slot to define how each header cell looks like; Suggestion: QTh

col.desc: Column definition associated to header cell

colsMap.desc: Column mapping (key is column name, value is column object)

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

selected.desc: (Only if using selection) Is row selected? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes selection state

expand.desc: Is row expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

header-cell-[name].desc: Slot to define how a specific header cell looks like; replace '[name]' with column name (from columns definition object)

col.desc: Column definition associated to header cell

colsMap.desc: Column mapping (key is column name, value is column object)

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

selected.desc: (Only if using selection) Is row selected? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes selection state

expand.desc: Is row expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

body-selection.desc: Slot to define how body selection column looks like; Suggestion: QCheckbox

rowIndex.desc: Row's index (0 based) in the filtered and sorted table

pageIndex.desc: Row's index (0 based) in the current page of the filtered and sorted table

colsMap.desc: Column mapping (key is column name, value is column object)

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

selected.desc: (Only if using selection) Is row selected? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes selection state

expand.desc: Is row expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

header-selection.desc: Slot to define how header selection column looks like (available only for multiple selection mode); Suggestion: QCheckbox

colsMap.desc: Column mapping (key is column name, value is column object)

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

selected.desc: (Only if using selection) Is row selected? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes selection state

expand.desc: Is row expanded? Can directly be assigned new Boolean value which changes expanded state

top-row.desc: Slot to define how top extra row looks like

bottom-row.desc: Slot to define how bottom extra row looks like

top.desc: Slot to define how table top looks like

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

prevPage.desc: Navigates to previous page, if available

nextPage.desc: Navigates to next page, if available

bottom.desc: Slot to define how table bottom looks like

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

prevPage.desc: Navigates to previous page, if available

nextPage.desc: Navigates to next page, if available

pagination.desc: Slot to override default pagination label and buttons

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

prevPage.desc: Navigates to previous page, if available

nextPage.desc: Navigates to next page, if available

top-left.desc: Slot to define how left part of the table top looks like

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

prevPage.desc: Navigates to previous page, if available

nextPage.desc: Navigates to next page, if available

top-right.desc: Slot to define how right part of the table top looks like

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

prevPage.desc: Navigates to previous page, if available

nextPage.desc: Navigates to next page, if available

top-selection.desc: Slot to define how top table section looks like when user has selected at least one row

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

prevPage.desc: Navigates to previous page, if available

nextPage.desc: Navigates to next page, if available

no-data.desc: Slot to define how the bottom will look like when is nothing to display

icon.desc: The suggested icon name (following Quasar convention)

row-click.desc: Emitted when user clicks/taps on a row; Is not emitted when using body/row/item scoped slots

row.desc: The row upon which user has clicked/tapped

index.desc: Index of the row in the current page

row-dblclick.desc: Emitted when user quickly double clicks/taps on a row; Is not emitted when using body/row/item scoped slots; Please check JS dblclick event support before using

row.desc: The row upon which user has double clicked/tapped

index.desc: Index of the row in the current page

row-contextmenu.desc: Emitted when user right clicks/long taps on a row; Is not emitted when using body/row/item scoped slots

row.desc: The row upon which user has right clicked/long tapped

index.desc: Index of the row in the current page

request.desc: Emitted when a server request is triggered

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

terms.desc: Terms to filter with (is essentially the 'filter' prop value)

getCellValue.desc: Optional function to get a cell value
Optional function to get a cell value

rows.desc: Array of row objects that were selected/unselected

keys.desc: Array of the keys of rows that were selected/unselected

added.desc: Were the rows added to selection (true) or removed from selection (false)

update:pagination.desc: Used by Vue on 'pagination.sync' prop for updating its value

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

update:selected.desc: Used by Vue on 'selected.sync' prop for updating its value

update:expanded.desc: Used by Vue on 'expanded.sync' prop for updating its value

virtual-scroll.desc: Emitted when the virtual scroll occurs, if using virtual scroll

details.desc: Object of properties on the new scroll position

index.desc: Index of the list item that was scrolled into view (0 based)

from.desc: The index of the first list item that is rendered (0 based)

to.desc: The index of the last list item that is rendered (0 based)

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

terms.desc: Terms to filter with (is essentially the 'filter' prop value)

getCellValue.desc: Optional function to get a cell value

setPagination.desc: Unless using an external pagination Object (through 'pagination.sync' prop), you can use this method and force the internal pagination to change

rowsPerPage.desc: How many rows per page? 0 means Infinite

prevPage.desc: Navigates to previous page, if available

nextPage.desc: Navigates to next page, if available

isRowSelected.desc: Determine if a row has been selected by user

clearSelection.desc: Clears user selection (emits 'update:selected' with empty array)

isRowExpanded.desc: Determine if a row is expanded or not

setExpanded.desc: Sets the expanded rows keys array; Especially useful if not using an external 'expanded' state otherwise just emits 'update:expanded' with the value

expanded.desc: Array containing keys of the expanded rows

col.desc: Column name or column definition object

resetVirtualScroll.desc: Resets the virtual scroll (if using it) computations; Needed for custom edge-cases

scrollTo.desc: Scroll the table to the row with the specified index in page (0 based)

index.desc: The index of the row in page (0 based)

edge.desc: Only for virtual scroll - the edge to align to if the row is not visible already (by default it aligns to end if scrolling towards the end and to start otherwise); If the '-force' version is used then it always aligns
